description: Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick refuses to recuse from Trump's Digital Asset Working Group despite maintaining $600 million stake in Tether, cryptocurrency under DOJ investigation for money laundering and sanctions evasion. His firm Cantor Fitzgerald recently settled $6.75 million SEC fraud charges. Lutnick's family continues benefiting through Bitcoin investments after his nominal divestiture to sons.
notes: Lutnick's massive Tether stake represents one of the largest financial conflicts in cabinet history. Tether, the world's largest stablecoin, faces DOJ investigation for facilitating money laundering, terrorism financing, and sanctions evasion. As Commerce Secretary overseeing trade and technology policy while serving on the Digital Asset Working Group, Lutnick can directly influence cryptocurrency regulation benefiting his $600 million position.

summary: Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick refuses to recuse from Trump's Digital Asset Working Group despite maintaining a $600 million stake in Tether, a cryptocurrency under DOJ investigation. Multiple sources, including Senator Elizabeth Warren's office, highlight Lutnick's significant conflicts of interest. Cantor Fitzgerald remains deeply involved with Tether, managing its Treasury reserves and brokering investments, while Lutnick claims he has 'divested' his interests, though his family maintains substantial connections to the cryptocurrency.
title: Commerce Secretary Lutnick Maintains $600 Million Tether Stake Despite DOJ Investigation and Senate Scrutiny
